author: xmha97
body:
Some command not working on [MSIX version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.0.0-rc.1/PowerShell-7.0.0-rc.1-win-x64.msix). 
But all command working fine on [MSI version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.0.0-rc.1/PowerShell-7.0.0-rc.1-win-x64.msi).
Please fix MSIX version.
![PowerShell Core](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23485114/72437974-23f5a500-37b9-11ea-9cb5-abc585f541f9.png)

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Does this work in Windows PowerShell?

comments.author: xmha97
comments.body:
> Does this work in Windows PowerShell?

This's work on Windows 10 built-in PowerShell and [MSI version of PowerShell Core](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases/download/v7.0.0-rc.1/PowerShell-7.0.0-rc.1-win-x64.msi)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: Despite requesting un-virtualized resources, it seems that the msix is still running in some sandbox.

comments.author: xmha97
comments.body:
After reinstalling Windows 10, this issue resolved.
So I closing this issue.

title: Some command not working on Msix version
